issue.title: Netlify: select a new build image

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort: < 60 min

labels.name: infrastructure
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to site infrastructure.

issue.body:
Notice from Netlify
> After November 15, 2022, builds for this site will fail unless you [update the build image](https://app.netlify.com/sites/cloudevents-io/settings/deploys#build-image-selection).

As reported via deploy logs:
> DEPRECATION NOTICE: Builds using the Xenial build image will fail after November 15th, 2022.
> 
> The build image for this site uses Ubuntu 16.04 Xenial Xerus, which is no longer supported.
All Netlify builds using the Xenial build image will begin failing in the week of November 15th, 2022.
>
> To avoid service disruption, please select a newer build image at the following link:
https://app.netlify.com/sites/etcd/settings/deploys#build-image-selection
>
> For more details, visit the build image migration guide:
> https://answers.netlify.com/t/please-read-end-of-support-for-xenial-build-image-everything-you-need-to-know/68239

comment.body: Seems to have started failing when the active Node.js LTS went from v16 to v18.

issue.body:
This as part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since Google has deprecated Universal Analytics (UA). For more details, see:
* https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  * A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

Since [notaryproject.dev](https://notaryproject.dev/) doesn't have any analytics set currently, we can begin with Google Analytics 4 (GA4).

(Edits by @chalin)

### Tasks

- [ ] Create a GA4 site tag under the CNCF Projects account.
  The new GA4 measurement ID is `G-ADD_ID_HERE`.
- [ ] Set GA4 ID in `config.yaml`
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events

/cc @chalin @caniszczyk

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort: < 60 min

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: good first issue

issue.body:
Currently, the homepage contains:

```html
<link rel="alternate" type="text/netlify" href="https://notaryproject.dev/_redirects">
```

The Netlify redirects file shouldn't be listed as an `alternate` to the site's homepage.

Note: The corresponding etcd.io issue is https://github.com/etcd-io/website/issues/437

issue.title: Google Analytics completely gone?
issue.body:
Hi, I'm working on [migrating CNCF projects from UA to GA4](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108). It seems that GA was replaced in favor of FA via:

- #784

But the GA ID still appears in the `config.toml` file (https://github.com/nats-io/nats-site/blob/a3766d53eb132b4616e46def0e16ee7585525d49/config.toml#L18

Which I figured could have been an omission, but the GA ID also still appears in nats.io page HTML. Is this because FA uses the same site ID, or is the ID used for another purpose?

If GA is completely gone, can you grant the CNCF access to your FA account?

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks:

- [ ] From the website data stream (`G-60C6Q1ETC1`), configure cross-domain measurement to docs.dapr.io
- [ ] Configure GA4 website ID ([gtag.js]) through [Netlify snippet injection]
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-58468480-3`, is still receiving events

Notes:

- For the main repo issue, see https://github.com/dapr/website/issues/71
- Each doc version is under it's own branch, and each is separately configured to use the UA ID

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

---

Current website analytics info: `UA-149338238-3` registered via old `analytics.js` library.

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[gtag.js]: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gtagjs
[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

comment.body:
Each doc version is under its own branch, and has its own individually configured UA ID. It'll be tedious to update all of those.

Do maintainers know if Azure Static Web Apps supports something like [Netlify snippet injection]? That would make the update to GA4 much easier for now, and in the future if the ID needs to be updated.

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
**Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA), in favor of its successor, Google Analytics 4 (GA4). This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4. For more details about the deprecation and the CNCF migration effort, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks: stages 1 & 2

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-V9SYWYG92Y`**
- [ ] Enable GA4 site tag, ideally via [Netlify snippet injection], leaving the GTM site tag in place.
- [ ] Ensure that the GA4 site tag is receiving events.

### Tasks: followup

Eventually, the GTM tag will stop working. Either it will need to be upgraded, or simply dropped in favor of the GA4 site tag.

### Sites

- **Main site**: this issue is for the main site, [cilium.io](https://cilium.io/), which is currently setup with a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag, `GTM-M533ZSF`.
- **Docs**: I'll be creating a separate issue for the `docs` subdomain, which is built from [cilium/cilium](https://github.com/cilium/cilium). This docs issue is:
  https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/22007

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks (stages 1, 2 & 3):

- [x] From the Prometheus websites data stream (`G-80ZM8LGB96`), configure cross-domain measurement to [promcon.io].
- [x] Configure GA4 website ID ([gtag.js]) through [Netlify snippet injection]
- [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-58468480-3`, is still receiving events

### Notes

- Related: https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181
- For later: #246
- Note: the UA tag can't be connected from the GA4 tag because it isn't using the [gtag.js] library, but even if it was, we'd want to avoid sending main-site events to the promcon UA tag and so it is easier to avoid connecting them than to setup filters (that would be useful only for a short period anyways, until UA is dropped by Google).

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @juliusv 

---

Current website analytics info:

- UA site tag: `UA-58468480-3`

Hugo layout relevant for the main tag:

- https://github.com/promcon/website/blob/0cf826e966e0b3f2320f31288df17fef698fae8a/layouts/default.html#L58-L67

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[gtag.js]: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gtagjs
[promcon.io]: https://promcon.io
[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Can't build site locally - GRAPHQL error due to missing HubspotEmails
issue.body:
Hi. It would be great if contributors could build the website locally. The instructions in the README don't work for me. So far, I've discovered that I need to `export GATSBY_DEFAULT_SITE_URL=http://localhost`, but even then, I'm getting this error:

```console
$ npm run build

> cilium.io@0.1.0 build
> gatsby build

success compile gatsby files - 1.708s
...
success onPreExtractQueries - 0.002s

 ERROR #85923  GRAPHQL

There was an error in your GraphQL query:

Cannot query field "objects" on type "HubspotEmails".

If you don't expect "objects" to exist on the type "HubspotEmails" it is most likely a typo. However, if you expect "objects" to exist there are a couple of
 solutions to common problems:

- If you added a new data source and/or changed something inside gatsby-node/gatsby-config, please try a restart of your development server.
- You want to optionally use your field "objects" and right now it is not used anywhere.

It is recommended to explicitly type your GraphQL schema if you want to use optional fields.

File: src/components/pages/newsletter/issues/issues.jsx:16:9

See our docs page for more info on this error: https://gatsby.dev/creating-type-definitions

not finished Running gatsby-plugin-sharp.IMAGE_PROCESSING jobs - 55.484s
failed extract queries from components - 5.402s
```

Maybe I need a bogus `HUBSPOT_API_KEY`, or some code changes might be required to allow that query to fail?

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks (stages 1, 2 & 3):

- [ ] Create a **GA4 data stream** under the [Prometheus - GA4 account](https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/?pli=1#/p334194995/reports/intelligenthome).
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-to-be-added-here`**
- [ ] [Connect] to the UA site tag from the GA4 data stream.
- [ ] Upgrade website to use [gtag.js] library and use the GA4 measurement ID
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-58468480-3`, is still receiving events

### Related

- https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @juliusv 

---

Current website analytics info:

- UA site tag: `UA-58468480-3`

Hugo layout relevant for the main tag:

- https://github.com/promcon/website/blob/0cf826e966e0b3f2320f31288df17fef698fae8a/layouts/default.html#L58-L67

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

comment.body:
I'm glad that you found that GDS template then! (Thanks for sharing your experience with GDS and validating that you found that challenging too.

My understanding of the data matches yours.

labels.name: kind/cleanup
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks, stage 1 (no code changes are necessary)

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag using the **GA4 setup assistant**
  from the "**Kubernetes - UA**" (`UA-36037335-10`) analytics console.
  - The new GA4 measurement ID is **`G-JPP6RFM2BP`**. User access is the same as for the original UA site tag.
- [x] Manually add the GA4 site tag to the list of `UA-36037335-10` **[Connected] Site Tags** under **Admin** > **Tracking Info** > [Tracking Code]
- [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).
- [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).

### Tasks, stage 2 (optional, can be done later)

- [x] Manually add `UA-36037335-10` as a connected site-tag of the GA4 tag
- [x] Switch to using GA4 ID:
  - [x] Netlify config - add environment variable (done by @onlydole, thanks!)
  - [x] #36010
  - [x] Wait for this to be deployed to the production server.
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events
- [ ] Enable GA for release-branch deploys
  - [ ] #36325
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events
- [ ] Remove the connection of the GA4 tag from the UA config and ensure events are still being processed:
  - [x] Remove the GA4 tag from the UA config: _Tracking Info > Tracking Code > Connected Site Tags_ section. By doing so, all non-kubernetes.io sites using the UA ID will stop forwarding events to the GA4 ID
  - [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events

### Other

- [x] Release-branches (see issue-comment below for 2022/09 page-view data):
  - [x] 1.21 - #37565
  - [x] 1.22 - #37566
  - [x] 1.23 - #37567
  - [x] 1.24 - #36322
  - [x] ~1.25 - #37669~ The 1.25 release branch had been created by mistake. It will be recreated from main in Dec.
- [ ] Look into [kubernetes.dev](https://www.kubernetes.dev/)
- [ ] #37657
- [ ] #37201

### Backup of UA data (later)

- As of 2024Q1 UA data will be deleted: ensure that #sig-docs-maintainers are aware of this so that they can plan, if necessary, a strategy for backing up the data.

@a-mccarthy et al.: I'm glad to make the stage 1 change if you grant me access to the analytics console for the UA site tag. If so, assign this issue to me.

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk 

---

Current website analytics info:

- Analytics snippet is added via `website/layouts/partials/head.html` -- for the relevant excerpt, see:
 https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/4b435b453bb3c6c06458337ce51ec7b48d7a74b7/layouts/partials/head.html#L9-L19
- Hugo version used is 0.101.0 

---

See also:

- #36011

[release-1.25 branch]: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/tree/release-1.25
[Tracking Code]: https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/a98841695w90600397p94297700/admin/tracking/tracking-code/
[Connected]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999

comment.body:
Update:

- All release-branch deploys (as of the time of writing) are using the GA4 tag
- I've removed the GA4 tag from the UA config. See the opening comment for details concerning this step.

issue.title: Page feedback: support Google Analytics 4

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Universal Analytics (UA) is deprecated. For details, see #1096. Here's some of the code associated with the page feedback feature: https://github.com/google/docsy/blob/d9bf98b876d74772b850ef910c6f59b898f61ccf/layouts/partials/feedback.html#L37-L53 This still uses the `analytics.js` library's `ga()` function. Note that this code is **incompatible with GA4** because of the library that is used and the event name, as is explained below. Tasks: - [ ] [Migrate from analytics.js to gtag.js](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/migration/ua/analyticsjs-to-gtagjs) - [ ] As part of the switch to `gtag.js`, we'll likely need to adjust the arguments for this custom page-feedback event. I don't know if we want to support both UA and GA4, or GA4 only. Probably both if it is easy enough.
The current code uses a `click` action name, and this becomes an event name in GA4. But GA4 uses `click` for **outbound clicks**. For details, see "outbound clicks" in [[GA4] Enhanced event measurement](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061). --- Notes: - Interestingly, Kubernetes docs had switched to using `gtag.js` in their override of [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) already 4 years ago - Indirectly related: - #175 /cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

comment.body:
In the interim, it seems that projects can define an event-modification rule through the analytics console interface, to change the event name of page-feedback events to `page_helpful` from `click`. For extra details, see https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/37657#issuecomment-1301548361.

Thanks for the pointer to the relevant GA4 doc pages @emckean! 🧡

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

comment.body: Progress: I've defined an [Event Modification rule](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/10085872) through the analytics console interface. It changes the event name of Docsy page-feedback events to `page_helpful` from `click`: > So far it is working in realtime in the debugger. It also is appearing in the Realtime overview events panel: > Here's an example of the parameters of one of these modified events: > I'm not sure how we can conveniently see `page_helpful` stats per page path. We might have to create a custom report for that. I'll check that tomorrow.

issue.body: - For the umbrella issue, see https://github.com/argoproj/argo-site/issues/102. - As of the time of writing this, the docs are built from mkdocs-material==7.1.7 (for GA support of 7.1.7, see [here](https://github.com/squidfunk/mkdocs-material/blob/3d6cbc9d2918deb7ef7b37f7d3cbe708288c2f7a/docs/setup/setting-up-site-analytics.md)): https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/90760a5088d0d1f965965b4f4d4d2d9335e337fa/docs/requirements.txt#L1-L2 We need at least 7.1.8 (the next patch release), in order to have **support for GA4**, as [documented here](https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/setup/setting-up-site-analytics): > --- - [ ] Upgrade mkdocs-material to v7.1.8+ - [ ] If it turns out that GA4 doesn't support the equivalent of UA [search-and-replace](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1034834) filters, then a change in path of the published doc pages for this site might be in order. I'm still investigating this. Until a solution is found, we probably shouldn't register this site's page view with the unified GA4 web site tag. /cc @alexmt @alexec

issue.title: [docs] deploy to gh-pages?

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
The main site and other Argo docs are published via gh-pages:

- https://argoproj.github.io/
- https://argoproj.github.io/argo-workflows/
- https://argoproj.github.io/argo-rollouts/
- https://argoproj.github.io/argo-events/

In contrast, Argo CD docs are available from:

- https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/

Have you considered publishing to gh-pages?

The main motivation to publishing to gh-pages would be uniformity, distinct page paths (making analytics easier to manage), and eventually a potentially smoother transition to the Argo domain, [argoproj.io](http://argoproj.io/).

/cc @alexmt

issue.title: Build fails in GitPod, from a fresh clone, including build-docs

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
Checklist:

* [x] I've searched in the docs and FAQ for my answer: https://bit.ly/argocd-faq.
* [x] I've included steps to reproduce the bug.
* [ ] ~I've pasted the output of `argocd version`.~

**Describe the bug**

The repo build fails when opening in GitPod from a fresh clone of this repo. The terminal window shows the following errors:

```console
gitpod /workspace/argo-cd (master) $  HISTFILE=/workspace/.gitpod/cmd-0 history -r; {
> make mod-download-local dep-ui-local && GO111MODULE=off go install github.com/mattn/goreman@latest
> } && {
> make start-test-k8s
> }
go mod download && go mod tidy # go mod download changes go.sum https://github.com/golang/go/issues/42970
github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/v2: open /go-build-cache/70/702414585327e67be88ce95208ea654d319f3489a032d41674aae3c63f07ed1a-d: permission denied
... 
```

Followed by many lines of `permission denied`.

**To Reproduce**

Follow the 3-step instructions given in https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer-guide/use-gitpod/#how-to-use-it. In step 3 it is written "Please wait until you see Kubeconfig is available at /tmp/kubeconfig message", but we never get that message.

**Expected behavior**

The instructions in [How To Use It (GitPod)](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer-guide/use-gitpod/#how-to-use-it) should work out-of-the-box. After that, I'd expect to be able to build the docs, but that fails too:

```console
# gitpod /workspace/argo-cd (master) 
$ make build-docs
docker run  --rm -it -p 8000:8000 -v /workspace/argo-cd:/docs squidfunk/mkdocs-material:4.1.1 build
Unable to find image 'squidfunk/mkdocs-material:4.1.1' locally
4.1.1: Pulling from squidfunk/mkdocs-material
...
Digest: sha256:64f28fb785bd583c29191472b7147c013bd3fafe4ddbed31d9453ad603c6b223
Status: Downloaded newer image for squidfunk/mkdocs-material:4.1.1
ERROR   -  Config value: 'markdown_extensions'. Error: Failed loading extension "markdown_include.include". 

Aborted with 1 Configuration Errors!
make: *** [Makefile:515: build-docs] Error 1
```

**Context**

I'm trying to build the docs as part of my work on the following:

- https://github.com/argoproj/argo-site/issues/102

Related issues:

- #10850

/cc @alexmt

issue.title: Docsy v0.5.0 - Build error after auto update
issue.body:
Hello,

We have followed the instructions found on migrating Docsy to a module in our project. However, today when building our project, we see that Docsy is automatically upgrading from v0.04.0 => v0.5.0 which is causing our builds to fail. The changelog from Docsy's most recent commit explains that there are breaking changes, which causes our projects to fail when running `hugo server`. We get the following error in our terminal:

`Error: Error building site: failed to render pages: render of "page" failed: execute of template failed: template: docs/single.html:30:7: executing "docs/single.html" at <partial "scripts.html" .>: error calling partial: "C:\Users\user~1\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo_cache\modules\filecache\modules\pkg\mod\github.com\google\docsy@v0.5.0\layouts\partials\scripts.html:51:16": execute of template failed: template: partials/scripts.html:51:16: executing "partials/scripts.html" at <resources>: can't evaluate field GetRemote in type interface {}  `

Furthermore, the page in the documentation on [https://www.docsy.dev/docs/updating/convert-site-to-module/](url) doesn't make it clear that converting to a module forces users to take on every new release once it is active. Therefore, above the issue explained earlier, we see the following:

1. We want the power to be able to vet the Docsy releases on our own without being forced auto-update when there is a new release.
2. If we already ran `hugo server` and now being forced to run v0.5.0, we are not able to revert the go.mod file back to call v0.4.0, as each time we run `hugo server` the error above is being called from v0.5.0 release.

`Error: Error building site: failed to render pages: render of "page" failed: execute of template failed: template: docs/single.html:30:7: executing "docs/single.html" at <partial "scripts.html" .>: error calling partial: "C:\Users\user~1\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo_cache\modules\filecache\modules\pkg\mod\github.com\google\docsy@v0.5.0\layouts\partials\scripts.html:51:16": execute of template failed: template: partials/scripts.html:51:16: executing "partials/scripts.html" at <resources>: can't evaluate field GetRemote in type interface {}  `

Furthermore, the page in the documentation on [https://www.docsy.dev/docs/updating/convert-site-to-module/](url) doesn't make it clear that converting to a module forces users to take on every new release once it is active. Therefore, above the issue explained earlier, we see the following:

issue.title: Feedback form on pages includes clicks from bots in Google Analytics

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body: **This is a Bug Report** Looking at the data from out feedback form, it appears that a lot of data is from bots. Google Analytics has a way to filter bot activity, https://support.google.com/analytics/thread/16422940?hl=en. But we do not have that enabled It looks like bot activity is turned off by default in the next version of Google Analytics, https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9888366?hl=en. We are in the process of migrating to this version in https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299. **Problem:** It looks like bot activity is throwing off users feedback in out feedback forms. For example, in the screen shot, this page has 41 response on the feedback form, but they are all from the same day. **Proposed Solution:** Exclude bot data from the charts, https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9888366?hl=en. **Page to Update:** This would be a change in Google Analytics.

comment.body:
I've promoted this issue upstream:

- https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1303

I _think_ that we'll need a programatic solution, filtering probably won't be effective -- glad to be proven wrong though.

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

labels.name: kind/cleanup
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to cleaning up code, process, or technical debt.

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks, stage 1 (no code changes are necessary)

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag using the **GA4 setup assistant**
  from the "**Kubernetes - UA**" (`UA-36037335-10`) analytics console.
  - The new GA4 measurement ID is **`G-JPP6RFM2BP`**. User access is the same as for the original UA site tag.
- [x] Manually add the GA4 site tag to the list of `UA-36037335-10` **[Connected] Site Tags** under **Admin** > **Tracking Info** > [Tracking Code]
- [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).
- [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).

### Tasks, stage 2 (optional, can be done later)

- [x] Manually add `UA-36037335-10` as a connected site-tag of the GA4 tag
- [x] Switch to using GA4 ID:
  - [x] Netlify config - add environment variable (done by @onlydole, thanks!)
  - [x] #36010
  - [x] Wait for this to be deployed to the production server.
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events
- [ ] Enable GA for release-branch deploys
  - [ ] #36325
  - [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events
- [ ] Remove the connection of the GA4 tag from the UA config: remove from _Tracking Info > Tracking Code > Connected Site Tags_ section. By doing so, all non-kubernetes.io sites using the UA ID will stop forwarding events to the GA4 ID
  - [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events

### Other

- [ ] Release-branches (see issue-comment below for pages views during 2022/09). It seems that v1.21 and up are actively used:
  - [ ] 1.25, since it is a separate [release-1.25 branch] already - this should be a backport of the  relevant`main` branch updates
  - [x] 1.24 - #36322
  - [ ] 1.23 - #37567
  - [ ] 1.22 - #37566
  - [ ] 1.21 - #37565
- [ ] Look into [kubernetes.dev](https://www.kubernetes.dev/)
- [ ] #37657

### Backup of UA data (later)

- As of 2024Q1 UA data will be deleted: ensure that #sig-docs-maintainers are aware of this so that they can plan, if necessary, a strategy for backing up the data.

@a-mccarthy et al.: I'm glad to make the stage 1 change if you grant me access to the analytics console for the UA site tag. If so, assign this issue to me.

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk 

---

Current website analytics info:

- Analytics snippet is added via `website/layouts/partials/head.html` -- for the relevant excerpt, see:
 https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/4b435b453bb3c6c06458337ce51ec7b48d7a74b7/layouts/partials/head.html#L9-L19
- Hugo version used is 0.101.0 

---

See also:

- #36011

[release-1.25 branch]: https://github.com/kubernetes/website/tree/release-1.25
[Tracking Code]: https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/#/a98841695w90600397p94297700/admin/tracking/tracking-code/
[Connected]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4
issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

issue.title: Page feedback: support Google Analytics 4

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Universal Analytics (UA) is deprecated. For details, see #1096. Here's some of the code associated with the page feedback feature: https://github.com/google/docsy/blob/d9bf98b876d74772b850ef910c6f59b898f61ccf/layouts/partials/feedback.html#L37-L53 This still uses the `analytics.js` library's `ga()` function. Note that this code is **incompatible with GA4** because of the library that is used and the event name, as is explained below. Tasks: - [ ] [Migrate from analytics.js to gtag.js](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/migration/ua/analyticsjs-to-gtagjs) - [ ] As part of the switch to `gtag.js`, we'll likely need to adjust the arguments for this custom page-feedback event. I don't know if we want to support both UA and GA4, or GA4 only. Probably both if it is easy enough.
The current code uses a `click` action name, and this becomes an event name in GA4. But GA4 uses `click` for **outbound clicks**. For details, see "outbound clicks" in [[GA4] Enhanced event measurement](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061). --- Notes: - Interestingly, Kubernetes docs had switched to using `gtag.js` in their override of [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) already 4 years ago - Indirectly related: - #175 /cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

comment.body: Note: the use of `click` as a custom event name _might not prevent_ projects from accessing page-feedback event data (I'm still exploring how to do this in GA4), but it does seem to make it unnecessarily harder when the same event name is also used by GA4 for another purpose.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,181 @@
+---
+title: Front-end Overhaul of the OpenTelemetry Demo (Go to Next.js)
+linkTitle: OTel Demo Front-end Overhaul
+date: 2022-10-18
+author: "[Oscar Reyes](https://github.com/xoscar) (Tracetest)"
+canonical_url: https://tracetest.io/blog/frontend-overhaul-opentelemetry-demo
+---
+
+One of the OpenTelemetry Project's many Special Interest Groups (SIG) is the
+[OpenTelemetry Community demo SIG](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-demo).
+The SIG supports a set of instrumented microservices and a front-end web app
+which are used to show how to instrument a distributed system with
+OpenTelemetry.
+
+The main focus of the web app is to demonstrate how to instrument an
+application, no matter what programming language, platform or OS it uses. The
+web app also shows different instrumentation techniques: automatic and manual,
+metrics, and baggage. All while following the standards and conventions
+prescribed in the official OTel documentation. More about the specific
+requirements can be
+[found here](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-demo/tree/main/docs/requirements).
+
+My company was focused on becoming part of and embracing the OpenTelemetry
+community. One of our goals this summer was to get more involved with a core
+OpenTelemetry project where we could provide a meaningful contribution. The OTel
+demo was the best match for our goal, as contributing would not only help the
+community, but also provide a great example to test and showcase our product
+with.
+
+The first thing we did was to get in contact with
+[Carter Socha](https://github.com/cartersocha), the organizer of the OTel Demo
+SIG. Carter was really welcoming and helped us identify where our contributions
+could be the most impactful. We started looking at
+[the issue created by Austin Parker](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-demo/issues/39)
+referencing a complete front-end overhaul that would involve moving the
+application away from Go server-side render (SSR) to an architecture that
+included a browser-side client (client-side render or CSR), as well as improving
+the overall style, theme, and user experience.
+
+A fun aspect of the work was the request to move the store from a "normal" store
+to an astronomy store to match the OpenTelemetry project’s overall branding.
+
+Once we got the green light from the rest of the OTel demo SIG, then we started
+working on the different changes that were part of the front-end architecture
+overhaul.
+
+## OpenTelemetry Demo Application Description and Tech Stack
+
+The demo app is an astronomy store, with basic eCommerce features such as a
+shopping cart, currency selector, payment, and checkout. It also includes the
+ability to display promotions (ads) and related products depending on the user’s
+context.
+
+The demo’s stack includes multiple microservices in different languages,
+covering each of the following OTel-supported languages:
+
+- [.NET](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/net/)
+- [C++](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/cpp/)
+- [Erlang/Elixir](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/erlang/)
+- [Go](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/go/)
+- [Node.js](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/js/)
+- [PHP](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/php/)
+- [Python](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/python/)
+- [Ruby](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/ruby/)
+- [Rust](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/instrumentation/rust/)

issue.title: Docsy v0.5.0 - Build error after auto update
issue.body:
Hello,

We have followed the instructions found on migrating Docsy to a module in our project. However, today when building our project, we see that Docsy is automatically upgrading from v0.04.0 => v0.5.0 which is causing our builds to fail. The changelog from Docsy's most recent commit explains that there are breaking changes, which causes our projects to fail when running `hugo server`. We get the following error in our terminal:

`Error: Error building site: failed to render pages: render of "page" failed: execute of template failed: template: docs/single.html:30:7: executing "docs/single.html" at <partial "scripts.html" .>: error calling partial: "C:\Users\user~1\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo_cache\modules\filecache\modules\pkg\mod\github.com\google\docsy@v0.5.0\layouts\partials\scripts.html:51:16": execute of template failed: template: partials/scripts.html:51:16: executing "partials/scripts.html" at <resources>: can't evaluate field GetRemote in type interface {}  `

Furthermore, the page in the documentation on [https://www.docsy.dev/docs/updating/convert-site-to-module/](url) doesn't make it clear that converting to a module forces users to take on every new release once it is active. Therefore, above the issue explained earlier, we see the following:

1. We want the power to be able to vet the Docsy releases on our own without being forced auto-update when there is a new release.
2. If we already ran `hugo server` and now being forced to run v0.5.0, we are not able to revert the go.mod file back to call v0.4.0, as each time we run `hugo server` the error above is being called from v0.5.0 release.

comment.body: Hi @kimberleybrown. I haven't read through all the details in this issue, but I thought that I'd drop a quick note: have you tried with 0.5.1, which is an official release. 0.5.0 was broken and never officially released. /cc @geriom

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+---
+title: Supporting Jaeger with native OTLP
+linkTitle: Jaeger OTLP support
+date: 2022-10-31
+author: >-
+  [Jason Plumb](https://github.com/breedx-splk) (Splunk)
+---
+
+Back in May of 2022, the Jaeger project
+[announced native support for the OpenTelemetry Protocol](https://medium.com/jaegertracing/introducing-native-support-for-opentelemetry-in-jaeger-eb661be8183c)
+(OTLP). This followed a
+[generous deprecation cycle](https://twitter.com/YuriShkuro/status/1455170693197402119)
+for the Jaeger client libraries across many languages. With these changes,
+OpenTelemetry users are now able to send traces into Jaeger with
+industry-standard OTLP, and the Jaeger client library repositories have been
+finally archived.
+
+We intend to deprecate Jaeger exporters from OpenTelemetry in the near future,
+and are looking for your feedback to determine the length of the depreation
+phase. The best way to provide feedback is by
+[filling out a 4-question survey](https://forms.gle/aUuJg5DQwNzncJ4s8) or
+commenting on
+[the existing draft pull request](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/pull/2858).
+
+## OpenTelemetry Support
+
+This interoperability is a wonderful victory both for Jaeger users and for
+OpenTelemetry users. However, we're not done yet. The OpenTelemetry
+specification still requires support for Jaeger client exporters across
+languages.
+
+This causes challenges for both Jaeger users and OpenTelemetry maintainers:
+
+1.  **Confusing Choices**
+
+    Currently, users are faced with a choice of exporter (Jaeger or OTLP), and
+    this can be a source of confusion. A user might be inclined, when exporting
+    telemetry to Jaeger, to simply choose the Jaeger exporter because the name
+    matches (even though Jaeger now actively encourages the use of OTLP).
+
+    If we can eliminate this potentially confusing choice, we can improve the
+    user experience and continue standardizing on a single interoperable
+    protocol. We love it when things "just work" out of the box!
+
+2.  **Maintenance and duplication**
+
+    Because the Jaeger client libraries are now archived, they will not receive
+    updates (including security patches). To continue properly supporting Jaeger
+    client exporters, OpenTelemetry authors would be required to re-implement
+    some of the functionality it had previously leveraged from the Jaeger
+    clients.
+
+    Now that Jaeger supports OTLP, this feels like a step backwards: It results
+    in an increased maintenance burden with very little benefit.
+
+Now that Jaeger supports OTLP, this feels like a step backwards: It results in
+an increased maintenance burden with very little benefit.
+
+### User Impact
+
+The proposal is to deprecate the following exporters from OpenTelemetry in favor
+of using native OTLP into Jaeger:
+
+- Jaeger Thrift over HTTP
+- Jaeger Protobuf via gRPC
+- Jaeger Thrift over UDP
+
+In addition to application configuration changes, there could be other
+architectural considerations. HTTP and gRPC should be straightforward
+replacements, although it may require exposing ports 4317 and 4318 if they are
+not already accessible.
+
+Thrift over UDP implies the use of the
+[Jaeger Agent](https://www.jaegertracing.io/docs/1.24/architecture/#agent).
+Users with this deployment configuration will need to make a slightly more
+complicated change, typically one of the following:
+
+1. Direct ingest. Applications will change from using Thrift+UDP to sending OTLP
+   traces directly to their `jaeger-collector` instance. This may also have
+   sampling implications.
+2. Replacing the Jaeger Agent with a sidecar
+   [OpenTelemetry Collector](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector)
+   instance. This could have sampling implications and requires changes to your
+   infrastructure deployment code.
+
+## Intent to Deprecate - We'd Like Your Feedback!
+
+In order to better support users and the interop between OpenTelemetry and
+Jaeger, we intend to deprecate and eventually remove support for Jaeger client
+exporters in OpenTelemetry.
+
+We would like your feedback! We want to hear from users who could be impacted by
+this change. To better make a data-informed decision,
+[we have put together a short 4-question survey](https://forms.gle/aUuJg5DQwNzncJ4s8).

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-93T2VC0VBC`**
- [x] Main website - `UA-82811140-41`:
  - [x] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [x] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID - #241
  - [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
  - [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-82811140-41`, is receiving events
- [ ] [docs.fluentd.org](https://docs.fluentd.org/) - `UA-181341719-4`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID
- [ ] [docs.fluentbit.io](https://docs.fluentbit.io/) - `UA-181341719-3`, which CNCF doesn't currently have access to
  - [ ] [Connect] UA site tag from the GA4 site tag.
  - [ ] Use [gtag.js] library to register GA4 ID

### Later

- [ ] Cleanup: there are still traces in the main site pages of the old GTM ID. Those scripts should be removed.

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @fujimotos 

---

Related, background & prep-work:

- #100: apparently TD used `GTM-T7BJ3X` and the CNCF used `GTM-TFCP8WJ` though there is no trace of such a GTM ID at the CNCF.
- #234

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[gtag.js]: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gtagjs

issue.title: Analytics: resolve redundant-hostnames warning
issue.body:
Google analytics reports the following issue:

> Property prometheus.io is receiving data from redundant hostnames. Some of the redundant hostnames are:
>
> - prometheus.io
> - www.prometheus.io
>
> Redundant hostnames are counted as separate rows in reports, so hits that are going to the same page on your site from different hostnames will be split into multiple rows. With data split across multiple rows, traffic to specific pages will appear lower than it actually is.

/cc @caniszczyk

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks:

- [ ] From the website data stream (`G-60C6Q1ETC1`), configure cross-domain measurement to docs.dapr.io
- [ ] Configure GA4 website ID ([gtag.js]) through [Netlify snippet injection]
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [ ] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-58468480-3`, is still receiving events

Notes:

- For the main repo issue, see https://github.com/dapr/website/issues/71
- Each doc version is under it's own branch, and each is separately configured to use the UA ID

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

---

Current website analytics info: `UA-149338238-3` registered via old `analytics.js` library.

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[gtag.js]: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gtagjs
[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

comment.body:
Each doc version is under its own branch, and has its own individually configured UA ID. It'll be tedious to update all of those.

Do maintainers know if Azure Static Web Apps supports something like [Netlify snippet injection]? That would make the update to GA4 much easier for now, and in the future if the ID needs to be updated.

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
**Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA), in favor of its successor, Google Analytics 4 (GA4). This issue is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4. For more details about the deprecation and the CNCF migration effort, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to a suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks: stages 1 & 2

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag under the **CNCF projects** account.
  The new GA4 stream measurement ID is: **`G-V9SYWYG92Y`**
- [ ] Enable GA4 site tag, ideally via [Netlify snippet injection], leaving the GTM site tag in place.
- [ ] Ensure that the GA4 site tag is receiving events.

### Tasks: followup

Eventually, the GTM tag will stop working. Either it will need to be upgraded, or simply dropped in favor of the GA4 site tag.

### Sites

- **Main site**: this issue is for the main site, [cilium.io](https://cilium.io/), which is currently setup with a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag, `GTM-M533ZSF`.
- **Docs**: I'll be creating a separate issue for the `docs` subdomain, which is built from [cilium/cilium](https://github.com/cilium/cilium). This docs issue is:
  https://github.com/cilium/cilium/issues/22007

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Migrate to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks (stages 1, 2 & 3):

- [x] From the Prometheus websites data stream (`G-80ZM8LGB96`), configure cross-domain measurement to [promcon.io].
- [x] Configure GA4 website ID ([gtag.js]) through [Netlify snippet injection]
- [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events
- [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-58468480-3`, is still receiving events

### Notes

- Related: https://github.com/prometheus/docs/issues/2181
- For later: #246
- Note: the UA tag can't be connected from the GA4 tag because it isn't using the [gtag.js] library, but even if it was, we'd want to avoid sending main-site events to the promcon UA tag and so it is easier to avoid connecting them than to setup filters (that would be useful only for a short period anyways, until UA is dropped by Google).

/cc @nate-double-u @caniszczyk @juliusv 

---

Current website analytics info:

- UA site tag: `UA-58468480-3`

Hugo layout relevant for the main tag:

- https://github.com/promcon/website/blob/0cf826e966e0b3f2320f31288df17fef698fae8a/layouts/default.html#L58-L67

[connect]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9973999
[gtag.js]: https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gtagjs
[promcon.io]: https://promcon.io
[Netlify snippet injection]: https://docs.netlify.com/site-deploys/post-processing/snippet-injection/

issue.title: Can't build site locally - GRAPHQL error due to missing HubspotEmails
issue.body:
Hi. It would be great if contributors could build the website locally. The instructions in the README don't work for me. So far, I've discovered that I need to `export GATSBY_DEFAULT_SITE_URL=http://localhost`, but even then, I'm getting this error:

```console
$ npm run build

> cilium.io@0.1.0 build
> gatsby build

success compile gatsby files - 1.708s
...
success onPreExtractQueries - 0.002s

 ERROR #85923  GRAPHQL

There was an error in your GraphQL query:

Cannot query field "objects" on type "HubspotEmails".

If you don't expect "objects" to exist on the type "HubspotEmails" it is most likely a typo. However, if you expect "objects" to exist there are a couple of
 solutions to common problems:

- If you added a new data source and/or changed something inside gatsby-node/gatsby-config, please try a restart of your development server.
- You want to optionally use your field "objects" and right now it is not used anywhere.

It is recommended to explicitly type your GraphQL schema if you want to use optional fields.

File: src/components/pages/newsletter/issues/issues.jsx:16:9

See our docs page for more info on this error: https://gatsby.dev/creating-type-definitions

not finished Running gatsby-plugin-sharp.IMAGE_PROCESSING jobs - 55.484s
failed extract queries from components - 5.402s
```

Maybe I need a bogus `HUBSPOT_API_KEY`, or some code changes might be required to allow that query to fail?

/cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

comment.body:
I'm glad that you found that GDS template then! (Thanks for sharing your experience with GDS and validating that you found that challenging too.

My understanding of the data matches yours.

issue.body:
This is part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since **Google has deprecated Universal Analytics** (UA). For more details, see:

- https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  - A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), 
  which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

### Tasks, stage 1 (no code changes are necessary)

- [x] Create a GA4 site tag using the **GA4 setup assistant**
  from the "**Kubernetes - UA**" (`UA-36037335-10`) analytics console.
  - The new GA4 measurement ID is **`G-JPP6RFM2BP`**. User access is the same as for the original UA site tag.
- [x] Manually add the GA4 site tag to the list of `UA-36037335-10` **[Connected] Site Tags** under **Admin** > **Tracking Info** > [Tracking Code]
- [x] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).
- [x] Confirm that the UA site tag, `UA-36037335-10`, is still receiving events (for a screenshot, see below).

### Tasks, stage 2 (optional, can be done later)

- [x] Manually add `UA-36037335-10` as a connected site-tag of the GA4 tag

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

issue.title: Add analytics

labels.name: e1-hours
labels.description: Effort: < 8 hrs

labels.name: infrastructure
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to site infrastructure.

issue.body:
This as part of a CNCF-wide effort to upgrade project websites to GA4 since Google has deprecated Universal Analytics (UA). For more details, see:
* https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/issues/108, including reference to:
  * A suggested [migration process](https://github.com/cncf/techdocs/blob/main/docs/analytics.md#migrating-to-google-analytics-4), which we've used to [migrate a few CNCF projects](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mx4LhdI2Un-rvGMI73SlHxQH9D2HABAJclMB3dd6lnA) already.

Since [notaryproject.dev](https://notaryproject.dev/) doesn't have any analytics set currently, we can begin with Google Analytics 4 (GA4).

### Tasks

- [ ] Create a GA4 site tag using the GA4 setup assistant from the UA site tag console.
  The new GA4 measurement ID is `G-ADD_ID_HERE`.
- [ ] Set GA4 ID in `config.yaml`
- [ ] Confirm that the GA4 site tag is receiving events

/cc @chalin @caniszczyk

comment.body:
> Will @nate-double-u continue to work on this issue?

I'll let @nate-double-u answer.

issue.title: Page feedback: support Google Analytics 4

labels.name: e0-minutes
labels.description: Effort < 60 min

issue.body:
Universal Analytics (UA) is deprecated. For details, see #1096. Here's some of the code associated with the page feedback feature: https://github.com/google/docsy/blob/d9bf98b876d74772b850ef910c6f59b898f61ccf/layouts/partials/feedback.html#L37-L53 This still uses the `analytics.js` library's `ga()` function. Note that this code is **incompatible with GA4** because of the library that is used and the event name, as is explained below. Tasks: - [ ] [Migrate from analytics.js to gtag.js](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/migration/ua/analyticsjs-to-gtagjs) - [ ] As part of the switch to `gtag.js`, we'll likely need to adjust the arguments for this custom page-feedback event. I don't know if we want to support both UA and GA4, or GA4 only. Probably both if it is easy enough.
The current code uses a `click` action name, and this becomes an event name in GA4. But GA4 uses `click` for **outbound clicks**. For details, see "outbound clicks" in [[GA4] Enhanced event measurement](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061). --- Notes: - Interestingly, Kubernetes docs had switched to using `gtag.js` in their override of [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) already 4 years ago - Indirectly related: - #175 /cc @caniszczyk @nate-double-u

comment.body:
In the interim, it seems that projects can define an event-modification rule through the analytics console interface, to change the event name of page-feedback events to `page_helpful` from `click`. For extra details, see https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/37657#issuecomment-1301548361.

Thanks for the pointer to the relevant GA4 doc pages @emckean! 🧡

issue.title: Ensure that page-feedback events are usable with Google Analytics 4

labels.name: area/web-development
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the kubernetes.io's infrastructure, design, or build processes

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
This can be viewed as a subtask of #35299 or a followup task, which is why I'm creating a separate issue. I'd vote for the latter.

While the website's custom [layouts/partials/feedback.html](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/main/layouts/partials/feedback.html) is already using the `gtag.js` library, the **custom event name** (`click`) **conflicts with GA4's use of the same name** to measure **[outbound clicks][]**.

It isn't clear to me yet if we can still (relatively easily) extract the page-feedback data or, for example, write custom GA4 i/f code to rectify this name clash, but IMHO, it would be easier to choose an event name that doesn't clash.

This is also an issue for Docsy, see https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1302. I'll likely be exploring solutions for Docsy, and can port the required changes here.

/cc @a-mccarthy @nate-double-u 

[outbound clicks]: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9216061?hl=en

comment.body: Progress: I've defined an [Event Modification rule](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/10085872) through the analytics console interface. It changes the event name of Docsy page-feedback events to `page_helpful` from `click`: > So far it is working in realtime in the debugger. It also is appearing in the Realtime overview events panel: > Here's an example of the parameters of one of these modified events: > I'm not sure how we can conveniently see `page_helpful` stats per page path. We might have to create a custom report for that. I'll check that tomorrow.

issue.title: Build fails in GitPod, from a fresh clone, including build-docs

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
Checklist:

* [x] I've searched in the docs and FAQ for my answer: https://bit.ly/argocd-faq.
* [x] I've included steps to reproduce the bug.
* [ ] ~I've pasted the output of `argocd version`.~

**Describe the bug**

The repo build fails when opening in GitPod from a fresh clone of this repo. The terminal window shows the following errors:

```console
gitpod /workspace/argo-cd (master) $  HISTFILE=/workspace/.gitpod/cmd-0 history -r; {
> make mod-download-local dep-ui-local && GO111MODULE=off go install github.com/mattn/goreman@latest
> } && {
> make start-test-k8s
> }
go mod download && go mod tidy # go mod download changes go.sum https://github.com/golang/go/issues/42970
github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/v2: open /go-build-cache/70/702414585327e67be88ce95208ea654d319f3489a032d41674aae3c63f07ed1a-d: permission denied
... 
```

Followed by many lines of `permission denied`.

**To Reproduce**

Follow the 3-step instructions given in https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer-guide/use-gitpod/#how-to-use-it. In step 3 it is written "Please wait until you see Kubeconfig is available at /tmp/kubeconfig message", but we never get that message.

**Expected behavior**

The instructions in [How To Use It (GitPod)](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer-guide/use-gitpod/#how-to-use-it) should work out-of-the-box. After that, I'd expect to be able to build the docs, but that fails too:

```console

issue.title: Docsy v0.5.0 - Build error after auto update
issue.body:
Hello,

We have followed the instructions found on migrating Docsy to a module in our project. However, today when building our project, we see that Docsy is automatically upgrading from v0.04.0 => v0.5.0 which is causing our builds to fail. The changelog from Docsy's most recent commit explains that there are breaking changes, which causes our projects to fail when running `hugo server`. We get the following error in our terminal:

`Error: Error building site: failed to render pages: render of "page" failed: execute of template failed: template: docs/single.html:30:7: executing "docs/single.html" at <partial "scripts.html" .>: error calling partial: "C:\Users\user~1\AppData\Local\Temp\hugo_cache\modules\filecache\modules\pkg\mod\github.com\google\docsy@v0.5.0\layouts\partials\scripts.html:51:16": execute of template failed: template: partials/scripts.html:51:16: executing "partials/scripts.html" at <resources>: can't evaluate field GetRemote in type interface {}  `

Furthermore, the page in the documentation on [https://www.docsy.dev/docs/updating/convert-site-to-module/](url) doesn't make it clear that converting to a module forces users to take on every new release once it is active. Therefore, above the issue explained earlier, we see the following:

1. We want the power to be able to vet the Docsy releases on our own without being forced auto-update when there is a new release.
2. If we already ran `hugo server` and now being forced to run v0.5.0, we are not able to revert the go.mod file back to call v0.4.0, as each time we run `hugo server` the error above is being called from v0.5.0 release.

issue.title: Feedback form on pages includes clicks from bots in Google Analytics

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body: **This is a Bug Report** Looking at the data from out feedback form, it appears that a lot of data is from bots. Google Analytics has a way to filter bot activity, https://support.google.com/analytics/thread/16422940?hl=en. But we do not have that enabled It looks like bot activity is turned off by default in the next version of Google Analytics, https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9888366?hl=en. We are in the process of migrating to this version in https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/35299. **Problem:** It looks like bot activity is throwing off users feedback in out feedback forms. For example, in the screen shot, this page has 41 response on the feedback form, but they are all from the same day. **Proposed Solution:** Exclude bot data from the charts, https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/9888366?hl=en. **Page to Update:** This would be a change in Google Analytics.

comment.body:
I've promoted this issue upstream:

- https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1303

I _think_ that we'll need a programatic solution, filtering probably won't be effective -- glad to be proven wrong though.
